entries.title: (Compatibility)
entries.body:
times_12_biuosdcetimes_24_biuosdce(Compatibility)times_12_biuosdce


These are provided for compatibility with HyperCard. They might have hard-coded values/reduced functionality, and are unlikely to be useful in new scripts.

You can enable compatibility mode for a stack by choosing monaco_9_biuosdceObject->Stack info...times_12_biuosdce and clicking monaco_9_biuosdceCompatibilitytimes_12_biuosdce in the panel on the right. This setting is saved with the stack and makes these changes for compatibility.
* You can say monaco_9_biuosdcebtn 2times_12_biuosdce instead of monaco_9_biuosdcecd btn 2times_12_biuosdce
* You can say monaco_9_biuosdceput "A" into item 3 of char 2 of xtimes_12_biuosdce which doesn't usually make sense
* You can say monaco_9_biuosdceput "new" into item 4 of line 3 of xtimes_12_biuosdce and get more intuitive behavior
* Uses HyperCard's less useful form for monaco_9_biuosdcelong idtimes_12_biuosdce, monaco_9_biuosdceownertimes_12_biuosdce, and monaco_9_biuosdcethe targettimes_12_biuosdce.

entries.body:

entries.title: get
entries.body:
times_12_biuosdcetimes_24_biuosdcegettimes_12_biuosdce


Evaluates any expression and saves the result to the variable "it".

The 'put' command is typically more useful.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce

get 2+3
put it into x
answer x -- shows 5

get the width of cd btn "myBtn"
put it into x
answer x -- shows the width of the specified button

entries.title: mark
entries.body:
times_12_biuosdcetimes_24_biuosdcemarktimes_12_biuosdce


Fully functional, might not be useful.
Sets the "marked" property on a card to true.

monaco_9_biuosdce
mark card id 1234
mark cards where the name of this card contains "b"
mark all cards
times_12_biuosdce

When cards are marked, you can conveniently reference them:
monaco_9_biuosdce
marked card 4
prev marked card
next marked card
first marked card
second marked card
last marked card
times_12_biuosdce

entries.title: on errorDialog
entries.body:
times_12_biuosdcetimes_24_biuosdceon errorDialogtimes_12_biuosdce



(Included for compatibility, unlikely to be useful for writing scripts).

A few error messages create an errorDialog event. The default response is
to show a script error at the offending line. If you write your own errorDialog
handler you can catch these events. However, because nearly all errors do not
go through errorDialog, this is unlikely to be useful.

entries.title: trappable: on doMenu
entries.body:
times_12_biuosdcetimes_24_biuosdcetrappable: on doMenutimes_12_biuosdce


You can make a custom monaco_9_biuosdcedoMenutimes_12_biuosdce handler that overrides the default one.

Hold the Shift key to bypass a customized monaco_9_biuosdcedoMenutimes_12_biuosdce.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce

-- in a card's script
on doMenu p1, p2
    if p1 == "New Card" then
        answer "Making a new card"
    end if
    send "doMenu "&quote&p1&quote&", "&quote&p2&quote to this stack
end doMenu
times_12_biuosdce

entries.title: trappable: on help
entries.body:
times_12_biuosdcetimes_24_biuosdcetrappable: on helptimes_12_biuosdce


You can make a custom monaco_9_biuosdcehelptimes_12_biuosdce handler that overrides the default one. However, the default one won't really ever be called, since you can't choose monaco_9_biuosdceHelptimes_12_biuosdce from the monaco_9_biuosdceGotimes_12_biuosdce menu in ViperCard.
